Best regards,SENIOR DESIGNER, WEB INFRASTRUCTURE PERFORMANCE MANAGEMENT

# 1049

The senior designer brings significant application domain
expertise in performance management to the R&D team. He/she is
responsible for establishing the product뭩 technical vision,
accelerating development of product features and capability,
mentoring a skillful team of software engineers, creating
functional specifications, leading and documenting the
architecture and design activities. The incumbent will also
contribute to coding critical modules and functionality, as well
as performing unit test activities.

Requirements engineering:

- be a principal participant in the product definition process
- contribute to the feature roadmap for the product
- participate in the feature and requirement prioritization
process
- leverage expertise in performance management to develop
solutions for various application requirements
- create functional specifications and conceptual design.

System Architecture & Software Design:

- lead the system architecture evolution
- lead technology architecture and evaluation for related areas
in the development of the product
- lead technical discussions and meetings
- coordinate the design of product subsystems and documentation
- actually design critical and risky software subsystems
- design the integration strategies of 3rd party tools and
systems into the product

Implementation:

- coordinate the code review process within the project team
- write and maintain the code for key system components
- provide 3rd level technical support for product related issues

Validation:

- participate in the pre-production and staging validation
process as needed, at the functional and system testing levels

Deployment & Support:

- assist as necessary in the deployment of code releases
- provide 3rd level technical support for product related issues
- provide technical expertise to other departments within the
company when required

Qualifications:

- university degree in Computer Science, Engineering or related
fields
- 8+ years of industrial experience developing and maintaining
complex software systems
- 3 years experience in Java programming
- expert knowledge of TCP/IP and the HTTP protocol
- a minimum of 3 years experience in a key design role in
implementing performance management solutions involving one or
more of the following fields: web log analysis, web application
infrastructure monitoring, Network and Event Management Systems
(BMC, OpenView), trend analysis, root cause analysis
- extensive experience with the Linux platform or Unix variants
- excellent knowledge of web based applications and technologies
(Java, J2EE, XML)
- excellent knowledge of several Java application servers
(WebLogic, WebSphere, Tomcat, Resin etc)
- excellent knowledge of web client technologies (browsers, HTML,
Java, JavaScript)
